info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 04 at 10:09AM MDT until June 04 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall will be possible, particularly near and downstream from the Hermits Peak/Calf Canyon and McBride wildfire burn scars. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central New Mexico, including the following areas, in central New Mexico, South Central Mountains. In north central New Mexico, East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...Until 9 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Scattered to numerous showers and thunderstorms will develop this afternoon and linger through mid-evening. Stronger storms will be capable of producing locally heavy rainfall. This combined with slow storm motion will result in an elevated risk of flash flooding over the Hermits Peak/Calf Canyon and McBride wildfire burn scars. An additional Flood Watch will likely be necessary for Monday afternoon and evening given a repeat of heavy rainfall and flash flood potential. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
